text: um-hum

text: well that's something

text: but it it seems to me that we've gotten a whole lot better um cooperation out here uh by setting it up so that we pay just a little bit extra uh

speaker: A
text: actually i don't think we pay very much extra at all too

speaker: A
text: but the um garbage men

speaker: A
text: come by uh on your regular garbage day and pick up the recycling out at the curb

speaker: A
text: yeah

speaker: A
text: we have burlap sacks

speaker: A
text: and they give us one for uh aluminum and uh steel one for metals

speaker: A
text: and one for glass

speaker: A
text: and then you can either bundle your newspapers or put them_1 in grocery bags

speaker: A
text: so we have we leave three little piles [laughter-of] [laughter-things] [laughter-out] [laughter-on] [laughter-the] [laughter-curb]

speaker: A
text: every Thursday

speaker: A
text: and the garbage men come by and uh collect them and leave us new bags when ours get old and ratty or leave the ones if they're still in good shape

speaker: A
text: and the it really pays for itself because oh then the city

speaker: A
text: gets the money from the recycling

speaker: A
text: yeah

speaker: A
text: the one thing i wish we could recycle is magazines

speaker: A
text: but they claim that because of the way they're bound they uh it's too expensive to recycle them

speaker: A
text: at my office

speaker: A
text: we have two big cardboard boxes in the library where everybody goes to pick up their mail

speaker: A
text: and they're uh

speaker: A
text: one's for white paper

speaker: A
text: and one's for colored paper

speaker: A
text: so anything like manuscripts or computer paper or

speaker: A
text: things like that goes in those boxes

speaker: A
text: but we get tons of catalogs and things like that and magazines

speaker: A
text: and there's no way to get rid of them_1

speaker: A
text: it just seems like such a waste

text: um-hum

speaker: A
text: well that would be a help

speaker: A
text: i wish they would do that here

speaker: A
text: we have got so little landfill space left that we're going to run out before the end of this decade

speaker: A
text: and it's really going to be a mess when we have to start hunting for places to put the things

speaker: A
text: we did have uh another novel uh experiment start this year

speaker: A
text: now we can put all our yard clippings out

speaker: A
text: you can you buy these super giant heavy duty paper bags

speaker: A
text: they're about four feet high

speaker: A
text: and you get them_1 for i think it's about fifty cents a piece at the grocery store um you usually buy them_1 by the dozen

speaker: A
text: and then you put all your [lard/yard] yard clippings and uh leaf rakings and anything that will be {compostible}

speaker: A
text: and those and the garbage men also pick those up on Thursdays

speaker: A
text: and then the uh they take them_1 to a special part of our dump where {composting} is and now in full swing

speaker: A
text: and at the end of every year uh they sell all the composts to nurserymen and to local people who want to put it on their [laughter-flowerbeds]

speaker: A
text: yeah

speaker: A
text: if they make it so that it's not a horrendous inconvenience i think most people would

speaker: A
text: right

speaker: A
text: no

speaker: A
text: i think it's i[t]- it's to me more of a convenience to have them come pick it up than

speaker: A
text: to get that two cents when you take it to the store

speaker: A

speaker: A
text: for cash

speaker: A
text: but so few people uh have enough to make that worthwhile you'd spend more in gas getting down there than you get back

text: uh-huh

speaker: A
text: yeah

speaker: A
text: well we can get a nickel a piece for any paper bags that we bring back to be reused

speaker: A
text: they just take it off like they do a coupon

speaker: A
text: they just subtract it from your bill

speaker: A
text: and they have a giant bin by the front door for the plastic bags

speaker: A
text: and they say you know as long as it's clean they don't want the a plastic bag that's full of goop [laughter]

speaker: A
text: here they don't want your rotted tomatoes

speaker: A

text: pickup

speaker: A
text: so they did say that you had to put it out within i think it was uh three weeks after

speaker: A
text: Christmas

speaker: A
text: and uh otherwise you would have to treat it like you would any other lawn refuse

speaker: A
text: it would have to be cut into four foot lengths

speaker: A
text: so you know if we have branches or something

speaker: A
text: they have to be cut in four foot lengths

speaker: A
text: but otherwise uh they have to be in one of their paper bags

speaker: A
text: and they even picked up our uh styrofoam pl[astic]- packing materials

speaker: A
text: they brought uh the week after Christmas they left a plastic bag on everybody's front doorknob with a little note on it saying we're trying something new next week only

speaker: A
text: if you have any uh of those little uh styrofoam peanuts that

speaker: A
text: any of your Christmas presents were packed in put them_1 in this bag and leave it out with your recycling

speaker: A
text: and we'll uh take all of those back and try to recycle them

speaker: A
text: but i

speaker: A
text: that's not going to be a regular feature

speaker: A
text: that was just a one time thing right after Christmas

speaker: A
text: well those things must take up a huge amount of space in landfills

speaker: A
text: they don't mash [laughter]

speaker: A
text: they don't compress at all

speaker: A
text: and they stay forever

speaker: A
text: it they really have to rely on businesses that generate a lot of that stuff

speaker: A

speaker: A
text: and you're not going to bother if you have one bag full

speaker: A

text: yeah

text: now we quit that about two years ago no three years ago when we got China mugs for everybody

speaker: A
text: so and the only difficulty with that is that we're in the middle of a five year drought

speaker: A
text: and so i- it's a real difficult choice whether we want styrofoam cups to fill up our landfills or uh China cups to use up our water [laughter]

speaker: A
text: but at the moment we're using the China cups

speaker: A
